Name: 2,2',6,6'-Tetrabromobisphenol A
Description: 3,3',5,5'-tetrabromobisphenol A is a bromobisphenol that is 4,4'-methanediyldiphenol in which the methylene hydrogens are replaced by two methyl groups and the phenyl rings are substituted by bromo groups at positions 2, 2', 6 and 6'. It is a brominated flame retardant. It is a brominated flame retardant and a bromobisphenol. It is functionally related to a bisphenol A.

plant_concentrations.References: (1) de Wit C et al; Chemosphere 46: 583-624 (2006) (2) He M et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 5748-5754 (2010
plant_concentrations.Value: 2,2',6,6'-Tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations of 0.019 and 0.14 ng/g have been detected in moss collected from Arctic regions of Norway(1).  Median 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations of 3618 and 8917 pg/g dry  weight were detected in grain and plant leaf (3 samples), respectively, collected from the Pearl River Delta, South China between 2005 and 2008(2).

animal_concentrations.References: (1) He M et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 5748-5754 (2010)
animal_concentrations.Value: Median 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations of 28 to 173 ng/g lipid weight were detected in six bird species collected from the Pearl River Delta, South China between 2005 and 2008(1).

fish_seafood_concentrations.References: (1) de Wit C et al; Organohalogen Compounds 66: 34811-3816 (2004) (2) Kotthoff M et al; Anal Bioanal Chem 409(14): 3685-3694 (2017) (3) He M et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 5748-5754 (2010)
fish_seafood_concentrations.Value: Atlantic cod liver from Norway contained 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations of 0.5 and 2.5 ng/g (lipid weight)(1). Sampling of fish muscle (bream, sole fish) collected from European freshwaters and estuaries between 2007-2014 detected 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A in 13 of 36 bream samples (range about 0.5-1.2 ug/kg wet wt) and 7 of 7 sole muscle samples (range about 0.5-0.7 ug/kg wet wt)(2). A median 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentration of 1.14 (0.23-1.74 ) ng/g lipid weight were detected in fish species (7 samples) collected from the Pearl River Delta, South China between 2005 and 2008(3).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) Watanabe I et al; Bull Environ Contam Toxicol 31: 48-52 (1983) (2) Watanabe I et al; Chemosphere 12: 1533-39 (1983) (3) DeCarlo V; Ann NY Acad Sci 320: 678-81 (1979) (4) de Wit CA; Chemosphere 46: 583-624 (2002) (5) de Wit C et al; Organohalogen Comounds 66: 34811-3816 (2004) (6) Qu G et al; Environ Svi Technol 47: 4760-4767 (2013) (7) Xu J et al; Environ Toxicol Chem 32(10): 2249-2255 (2013) (8) Harrad S et al; Environ Sci Technol 43: 9077-9083 (2009)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SEDIMENT: River sediment collected from the Neya River, Japan, in September 1981 contained approximately 20 ug/kg on a dry weight basis of 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A(1). Marine sediments collected from estuaries in Japan other than from Osaka Bay contained 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A at concentrations of <0.5 ppb to 1.8 ppb, dry weight basis(2). Marine sediments collected from estuaries in Osaka Bay contained 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A at 0.5 to 4.5 ppb while river sediments collected in Osaka contained this compound at concentrations from 22 to 140 ppb(2). Sediment samples collected in Arkansas contained unreported concentrations of 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A(3). Sediment samples upstream and downstream from a plastics plant contained 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations of 50 and 430 ng/g respectively(4). A sediment sample from the Tromso harbor (Northern Norway) contained a 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentration of 1.24 ng/g dry wt(5). Sediment samples collected downstream at varying distances from a factory in Hunan, China in 2010 had 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentrations ranging from about 140 to <5 ng/g dry wt (distances 0.5 to 7.7 km) with levels decreasing as distance from the factory increased(6). In 12 sediment samples collected from Taihu Lake, China (the third largest freshwater lake in China that is surrounded by highly developed cities and towns) in Sept 2010, 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A was detected at a concentration range of 0.056-2.15 ng/g dry wt(7). English lake sediments (9 samples) had a reported concentration range of 0.33-3.8 ng/g dry wt(8).

sediment_soil_concentrations.References: (1) DeCarlo V; Ann NY Acad Sci 320: 678-81 (1979). Available from, as of April 13, 2018: https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/287406 (2) Qu G et al; Environ Svi Technol 47: 4760-4767 (2013) (3) Zhu Z-C et al; Sci Total Environ 481: 47-54 (2014) (4) He M et al; Environ Sci Technol 44: 5748-5754 (2010)
sediment_soil_concentrations.Value: SOIL: Soil samples collected in Arkansas contained unreported concentrations of 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A(1). Soil samples collected downstream at varying distances from a factory in Hunan, China in 2010 had 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A derivative concentrations ranging from about 120 to 0.1 ng/g dry wt (distances 0.5 to 7.7 km) with levels decreasing as distance from the factory increased(2). Analysis of agricultural soil samples (n=38) collected Shouguang, China in May 2008 detected 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A at a mean concentration of 672 ng/g(3). A median 2,2',6,6'-tetrabromobisphenol A concentration of 295 (2.9-780) ng/g dry weight was detected in soil (4 samples) collected from the Pearl River Delta, South China between 2005 and 2008(4).
